You are the husband of our only daughter, Dhanala Kalpana, that is, our son-in-law. Therefore, out of our love and affection for you, and for your future happiness, we We hereby grant you the following Scheduled Property worth Rs. 6,55,000/- in characters, free of charge, and give you the said Settlement Property, waiving all rights we have had in it up to this date, and assigning all such rights to you, and taking full possession of the said Settlement Property on this very day. Therefore, from this amount, you shall take possession of the Scheduled Property and become the full rightful owner and shall be entitled to the same, and upon payment of Panchayat dues, you shall be entitled to the full possession, transfer, exchange, sale, and enjoyment of all such rights and privileges as you wish, throughout your generations, to your children and grandchildren. Therefore, we hereby declare that any disputes arising from any cause whatsoever, whether arising from feudal disputes or otherwise, shall be our own. We, our residents, can freely and freely dispose of this settlement property to you and your residents. We believe that this property is an undisputed property that has not been encroached upon by anyone else, and that the survey number, limits and boundaries are correct, and we have written and given you this settlement deed. Since the R.C.C. building is included in the schedule property, an M. Notice has been filed in the records of the Panchayat. This property is not assigned by the Government. It is not a property given as a D. Patta under Act 9/77. This land has mango, coconut, betel nut gardens, sweet potato gardens, trees, Missionary, granite, stone mines. If the authorities are under inspection, the government will be liable for the prosecution actions taken by them and will be able to pay the excise duty.
1. Thanala Gandhi
2. Dao Katalakshmii

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 3205 of 2025, dated 23/Sep/2025, executed by 1. Dhanala Gandhi 2. Dhanala Venkata Lakshmi in favour of their Son in law, Korra Philips, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 50 Sq. Yds, bearing house number 8-35, Assessment number 1188000384, comprised in survey number 470/4, situated in Akividu Village and Grama Panchayath, Akividu Mandal, within the District of West Godavari registered at sub-registrar office Akividu is bounded as follows: North by: Building of Dhanala Chinna Lakshmi South by: Building of Bangari Yesu East by: 4 Ft Width of Path Way and other Side Building of Alladi Siva Ramakrishna West by: Building of Somadula Ramu
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: 1. It is observed from the Encumbrance Certificate that the house number and survey number mentioned in the pledging deed are also reflected in other transactions vide Document Nos. 3229 of 2004, 950 of 2005, and 1498 of 1996. However, the extent, parties, and boundaries mentioned in the said transactions are differ from the pledging schedule. Hence, we presume those are not relevent to the Pledging Schedule, Therefore, the F.I. is advised to verify and proceed accordingly, as per internal policy. 2. Further, It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
